title: Sans Serif with "long" f (not italic)
content: I'm looking for a sans serif with a "long" f in small case, what I meen is an f that goes below the other letters. There seem to be many like this in italic but i'm looking for this in a regular cut. Sorry for the weird explanation but I dont now the word for this style, if there is one. I know Anivers and Fedra has this kind of small case regular f.
author: plojel

comments.content: ' [Fedra (Sans)](http://web.archive.org/web/20100201040907/http:/www.typotheque.com/fonts/fedra_sans)', by Peter Biľak (Typotheque), would be the first that comes to mind, as well. (And one great typeface, on top of that.)
Another one may be ' [Minimala](http://web.archive.org/)', by Karl-Heinz Lange + Ole Schäfer (Primetype).
Yes, Fedra is always nice, havent seen Minimala before but I like it so far. Thank you for your suggestions Dav.

I just noticed that Martin Majoor's Telefont has this kind of f. A small sample can be seen in [this article](http://web.archive.org/web/20100201040907/http:/www.typotheque.com/articles/my_type_design_philosophy).
